CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Paid Consumption stage positioned above or below the Post-Transmission stage?
SRP.A: The Paid Consumption stage is positioned {below} the Post-Transmission stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {logarithmic} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Post-Distribution?
VE.A: The value of stage Post-Distribution is {37753}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Billed Consumption?
VE.A: The value of stage Billed Consumption is {10771}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Post-Generation, with a value of {97592}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Paid Consumption, with a value of {8944}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Post-Transmission to stage Post-Distribution?
SC.A: Decreased by {22085} Megawatt Hours from stage Post-Transmission to stage Post-Distribution.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Post-Generation to stage Post-Transmission?
SC.A: Decreased by {37754} Megawatt Hours from stage Post-Generation to stage Post-Transmission.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 78715? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 16427? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Billed Consumption} stage has {10771}, the {Paid Consumption} stage has {8944}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 16427 and 48795? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Post-Distribution} stage has {37753}, the {Delivered to End Users} stage has {22084}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Billed Consumption to Paid Consumption, or from stage Post-Distribution to Delivered to End Users?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Post-Distribution} to {Delivered to End Users} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Post-Transmission to Post-Distribution, from stage Post-Distribution to Delivered to End Users, or from stage Delivered to End Users to Billed Consumption?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Post-Transmission} to stage {Post-Distribution} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Post-Generation} and {Post-Transmission} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Billed Consumption} and {Paid Consumption} stages.
